Developer Terms of Use
des:
Voice control for your Light just got more intuitive. Alexa now includes light’s color and brightness control. 
When using the skill, you need to specify by name which device to use. There are two ways to define names.
- Use the default name “Sleep Light”, but you can change it in the Alexa App, Or
- Create an Alexa group and add the device to the group in the Alexa App, name the group Bedroom or others. More information is available at http://tinyurl.com/alexa-smart-home-groups

Here are some of our favorite phrase to get started：
Light Control:
-You can turn devices on/off, for example“Alexa, turn on Sleep Light”or “Alexa, turn off my bedroom lights”.
Brightness Control:
-You can change the brightness, for example “Alexa, brighten bedroom to 50%”, or “Alexa, dim Sleep Light”.
Color Control:
-You can change the color, for example “Alexa, set my Bedroom light to red”or “Alexa,change Sleep Light to red”, try asking Alexa for “White”, “Red”, “Crimson”, “Salmon”, “Orange”, “Gold”, “Yellow”, “Green”, “Turquoise”, “Cyan”, “Sky Blue”, “Blue”, “Purple”, “Magenta”, “Pink” and “Lavender”.

How to Get Start？
1.Download SleepNote App in AppStore or GooglePlay and create a Sleepace account
2.Connect Sleep Light to your SleepNote account
3.Open Alexa App, and go to “Skills”
4.Search for “Sleep Light”or”Sleepace”
5.Enable the skill by clicking on the “Enable” button and log in to your SleepNote account
6.Say something to get start
